content.text:
# 2nd Critics' Choice Documentary Awards__disambig_1

| last             = 1st
| next             = 3rd
}}
The '''2nd Critics' Choice Documentary Awards were presented on November 2, 2017, in Brooklyn, New York, honoring the finest achievements in documentary filmmaking and non-fiction television. The nominees were announced on October 11, 2017.
Winners and nominees
{| class=wikitable
|-
| valign="top" width="50%"|
* Jane'
** Abacus: Small Enough to Jail
** Beware the Slenderman
** Bright Lights: Starring Carrie Fisher and Debbie Reynolds
** California Typewriter
** Chasing Coral
** City of Ghosts
** Cries from Syria
** Dawson City: Frozen Time
** Eagles of Death Metal: Nos Amis
** Ex Libris: The New York Public Library
** Faces Places
** Kedi
** One of Us
** Spettacolo
** Strong Island
| valign="top" width="50%"|
* 'Evgeny Afineevsky – Cries from Syria
* Frederick Wiseman – Ex Libris: The New York Public Library'
** Amir Bar-Lev – Long Strange Trip
** Matthew Heineman – City of Ghosts
** Bill Morrison – Dawson City: Frozen Time
** Doug Nichol – California Typewriter
** Jeff Orlowski – Chasing Coral
** Irene Taylor Brodsky – Beware the Slenderman
** Ceyda Torun – Kedi
** Agnès Varda & JR – Faces Places
|-
| valign="top" width="50%"|

** California Typewriter

| valign="top" width="50%"|

| valign="top" width="50%"|

** Trophy
|-
| valign="top" width="50%"|

| valign="top" width="50%"|

** The Defiant Ones
** Five Came Back
** The Keepers

|-
| valign="top" width="50%"|
* 'The Cats of Istambul – Kedi
* Etty Ausch – One of Us
* Al Gore – An Inconvenient Sequel: Truth to Power

** “Tell Me How Long” – Chasing Coral – By Kristen Bell
** “Prayers for This World” – Cries from Syria – By Cher
** “Best I Can” – Dina – By Michael Cera featuring Sharon Van Etten
** “Served Like a Girl” – Dancing Through the Wreckage – By Pat Benatar
|}
